de.lessvoid.nifty.spi

Interface NiftyRenderDevice


  • public interface NiftyRenderDevice
    NiftyRenderDevice is part of the SPI that allows Nifty to use different graphics backends. Everything that can be rendered will go through implementations of this interface.
    Author:
    void

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  NiftyRenderDevice.FilterMode
      The type of filtering to use when loading a texture (Actually this is the filtering mode of the texture after it has been loaded.
      static class  NiftyRenderDevice.PreMultipliedAlphaMode
      Specifies if loaded texture data already is pre-multiplied or if Nifty should pre-multiply it when loading.

      • loadTexture

        NiftyTexture loadTexture(String filename,
                         NiftyRenderDevice.FilterMode filterMode,
                         NiftyRenderDevice.PreMultipliedAlphaMode preMultipliedAlphaMode)
        Load an image and return a NiftyTexture from the image.
        Parameters:
        filename - the image filename to load
        filterMode - the filter mode to use for the loaded texture
        preMultipliedAlphaMode - the pre-multiplied alpha mode to use
        Returns:
        NiftyTexture

      • beginRender

        void beginRender()
        Nifty will call this before it issues render*() calls.

      • render

        void render(NiftyTexture texture,
            FloatBuffer vertices)
        Render a textured Quad with the given NiftyTexture using vertex data given in the FloatBuffer containing: - 2 floats x and y vertex position - 2 floats u and v texture coordinates - 4 floats red, green, blue, alpha color values
        Parameters:
        texture - the NiftyTexture to render
        vertices - the vertex data to render

      • renderColorQuads

        void renderColorQuads(FloatBuffer vertices)
        Render an untextured Quad with the vertex data given in the FloatBuffer containing: - 2 floats x and y vertex position - 4 floats red, green, blue, alpha color values for the vertex
        Parameters:
        vertices - the vertex data to render

      • renderLinearGradientQuads

        void renderLinearGradientQuads(double x0,
                               double y0,
                               double x1,
                               double y1,
                               List<NiftyColorStop> colorStops,
                               FloatBuffer vertices)
        Render a linear gradient with the given parameters using vertex data given in the FloatBuffer containing: - 2 floats x and y vertex position
        Parameters:
        x0 - the x position of the first edge point
        y0 - the y position of the first edge point
        x1 - the x position of the second edge point
        y1 - the y position of the second edge point
        colorStops - the list of colorstops
        vertices - the vertex data to render

      • endRender

        void endRender()
        Called after all render*() calls are done to end rendering.

      • beginRenderToTexture

        void beginRenderToTexture(NiftyTexture texture)
        Redirect all subsequent render calls to the NiftyTexture given as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        texture - the texture to use

      • endRenderToTexture

        void endRenderToTexture(NiftyTexture texture)
        Stop rendering to the given texture.
        Parameters:
        texture - the texture to use in the beginRenderToTexture() call to start rendering.

        Load a custom shader to be used for rendering later.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • pathLines

        void pathLines(FloatBuffer b,
               float lineWidth,
               NiftyLineCapType lineCapType,
               NiftyLineJoinType lineJoinType)
        Render lines from the given FloatBuffer containing the line vertices.
        Parameters:
        b - the FloatBuffer containing the vertex data
        lineWidth - the width of the line to render
        lineCapType - the line cap type to use
        lineJoinType - the line join type

      • pathArcs

        void pathArcs(FloatBuffer vertices,
              NiftyLineCapType lineCapType,
              float startAngle,
              float endAngle,
              float lineWidth,
              float radius,
              double lineColorAlpha)
        Render arcs using the information given. You'll get a quad the size of the full arc with the following coordinates (-1, -1) ( 1, -1) +---------------+ | | | | | + | | | | | +---------------+ (-1, 1) ( 1, 1) The quad will be the the size of the circle centered around the center of the circle. You'll get the following per vertex informations for each circle / quad (4 vertices per quad): - 2 floats x and y vertex position - 2 floats u and v "texture" coordinates with the coordinates given in the diagram above
        Parameters:
        vertices - the vertex data to render
        lineCapType - the line cap type
        startAngle - the start angle
        endAngle - the end angle
        lineWidth - the line width
        radius - the radius
        lineColorAlpha - the line color alpha
